metadata.title: CVE-2023-4004 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernel's netfilter in the waya user triggers the nft_pipapo_remove function with the element, without aNFT_SET_EXT_KEY_END. This issue could allow a local user to crash thesystem or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4004` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-82-generic - 5.15.0-82.91
linux-image-5.15.0-82-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-82.91
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-82-generic - 5.15.0-82.91
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-82-generic-64k - 5.15.0-82.91
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-82.91').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1040.45').
linux-allwinner-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1043.48').
linux-aws-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-6.2, was needs-triage').
